definitions: power to influence or direct people's behavior or course of events
device or mechanism used to operate or regulate a machine
group or condition used as a standard for comparison in scientific experiments
ability to manage one's emotions and reactions in difficult situations
examples: The company maintains strict control over its production processes
She lost control of the vehicle on the icy road
The temperature control on the air conditioner needs adjusting
He reached for the remote control to change channels
The control group received a placebo during the clinical trial
Scientists used distilled water as a control in the experiment
His remarkable control during the crisis impressed everyone present
She struggled to maintain control of her emotions

definitions: person responsible for supervising or managing something, especially operations or systems
electronic device that manages or directs the operation of another device or system
senior accounting officer responsible for financial reporting and compliance in an organization
examples: The air traffic controller guided planes safely through the busy airspace
The project controller oversees all aspects of the construction timeline
The game controller stopped responding during the crucial match
The programmable logic controller automates the manufacturing process
The company controller prepared the quarterly financial statements
She was promoted to controller after five years in accounting

definitions: prolonged public disagreement or heated discussion about a subject that divides opinion
examples: The new policy sparked controversy among environmental groups and businesses
The controversy surrounding the election results lasted for months

definitions: medical term for a bruise caused by trauma that damages tissue beneath the skin
examples: The doctor diagnosed multiple contusions on her legs after the fall
The boxer suffered a severe contusion above his left eye

definitions: confusing and difficult problem or question that seems to have no clear solution
riddle whose answer involves a pun or play on words
examples: The budget deficit presents a conundrum for policymakers this year
Scientists face the conundrum of protecting wildlife while allowing development
The children enjoyed solving conundrums at the birthday party
He posed an amusing conundrum about time travel paradoxes

definitions: time spent recovering one's health and strength after illness or medical treatment
examples: Her convalescence at the seaside resort lasted three months
The doctor recommended complete rest during his convalescence

definitions: person who is recovering from illness or medical treatment and regaining strength
examples: The convalescent required daily nursing care at home
Several convalescents stayed at the rehabilitation center

definitions: transfer of heat through movement of heated fluid or gas due to density differences
examples: Convection currents in the atmosphere create weather patterns
The oven uses convection to cook food more evenly

definitions: person who arranges and leads meetings or brings people together for a purpose
examples: The committee convener scheduled monthly meetings for members
She served as convener of the international conference

definitions: state of being able to proceed with something without difficulty or effort
thing that contributes to an easy and effortless way of life, such as an appliance or service
examples: Online shopping offers the convenience of purchasing from home
The hotel location provides convenience for business travelers
The kitchen has all modern conveniences including a dishwasher
Public transportation is a convenience many city dwellers rely upon

definitions: process or act of bringing people together for a meeting or formal gathering
examples: The convening of the emergency session took only two hours
She is responsible for convening the board of directors

definitions: building or group of buildings occupied by a community of nuns living under religious vows
examples: The medieval convent stood peacefully on the hillside
She decided to enter the convent after years of contemplation

definitions: large meeting or conference of members of a political party or profession
way in which something is usually done within a particular society or group
formal agreement between countries or states on particular matters
examples: Thousands attended the annual science fiction convention downtown
The political convention nominated their presidential candidate
It's a social convention to shake hands when meeting someone
Literary conventions in poetry have evolved over centuries
The Geneva Convention establishes standards for humanitarian treatment
Countries signed the convention on climate change last year

definitions: process of coming together from different directions to eventually meet or become similar
tendency of a mathematical sequence or series to approach a limit as terms are added
examples: The convergence of technology and medicine created new treatment options
Cultural convergence resulted from increased global communication
The convergence of the infinite series can be proven mathematically
Students studied the convergence of geometric sequences

definitions: process or action of moving toward the same point from different directions
examples: The converging roads met at the town center
Scientists observed the converging weather patterns on radar

definitions: informal interchange of thoughts and information by spoken words between two or more people
examples: Their conversation about politics lasted well into the evening
She overheard an interesting conversation at the coffee shop

definitions: situation, object, or statement that is the reverse or opposite of another
brand name for canvas sneakers with rubber soles, popular in casual fashion
examples: The converse of that theorem is also mathematically valid
If the statement is true, then its converse may be false
She wore her favorite Converse sneakers to the concert
The store had a sale on Converse high-tops

definitions: process of changing or causing something to change from one form to another
adoption of a new religion or abandonment of religion for a new faith
successful attempt at scoring extra points after a touchdown in American football
examples: The conversion of the warehouse into apartments took six months
Energy conversion from solar to electrical power increased efficiency
His conversion to Buddhism changed his entire worldview
The conversion experience happened during her pilgrimage
The team missed the two-point conversion in the final quarter
The kicker succeeded with the conversion after the touchdown

definitions: person who has changed their religious faith or other strongly held beliefs to different ones
examples: The new convert attended religious classes every week
She became a convert to organic farming after learning about pesticides

definitions: device that changes something from one form, purpose, or system to another
examples: The catalytic converter reduces harmful emissions from the car
You'll need a voltage converter to use that appliance abroad

definitions: automobile with a roof that can be folded back or removed entirely
something capable of being changed or transformed into a different form or function
examples: They drove the convertible along the coastal highway with the top down
The red convertible attracted attention wherever it parked
The convertible sofa transforms into a comfortable bed for guests
These convertible bonds can be exchanged for company stock

definitions: formal term for any vehicle or method used to transport people or goods
legal process of transferring property ownership from one person to another
examples: Horse-drawn carriages were the primary conveyance before automobiles
Public conveyance includes buses, trains, and subways
The lawyer prepared the conveyance documents for the house sale
The conveyance of the estate took several months to complete

definitions: process of carrying, transporting, or communicating something from one place or person to another
examples: The pipeline is conveying oil across hundreds of miles
She had difficulty conveying her emotions through words

definitions: continuous moving belt or system used to transport objects or materials in factories
examples: The conveyor belt carried packages through the warehouse
Workers stood beside the conveyor to inspect products

definitions: person found guilty of a criminal offense and serving a sentence in prison
examples: The escaped convict was captured after three days
Former convicts often struggle to find employment

definitions: formal declaration that someone is guilty of a criminal offense made by a jury verdict
firmly held belief or opinion that one is certain is true
examples: His conviction for fraud resulted in a five-year prison sentence
The court overturned the wrongful conviction after new evidence emerged
She spoke with conviction about the need for educational reform
His religious convictions guided every aspect of his life

definitions: large formal assembly of people, especially for a ceremony at a college or university
examples: The graduation convocation celebrated the achievements of five hundred students
The university convocation included distinguished speakers from around the world

definitions: group of ships or vehicles traveling together for mutual support and protection
examples: The military convoy stretched for miles along the desert highway
The humanitarian convoy delivered supplies to the refugee camp

definitions: soft murmuring sound made by doves or pigeons, or similar gentle sound made by humans
examples: The gentle coo of doves filled the morning garden
The baby's happy coo delighted her parents

definitions: person who prepares and cooks food, either professionally or domestically
examples: The restaurant hired a new cook with ten years experience
She's an excellent cook who loves experimenting with recipes

definitions: book containing recipes and instructions for preparing and cooking food
examples: Her grandmother's cookbook contained treasured family recipes
The vegetarian cookbook became a bestseller last year

definitions: appliance used for cooking food, especially a stove with an oven
examples: The electric cooker needs to be replaced after twenty years
She bought a pressure cooker to prepare meals faster

definitions: practice or skill of preparing and cooking food as an art or craft
examples: She studied French cookery at a prestigious culinary school
The television show featured traditional British cookery

definitions: small sweet cake typically round and flat made from flour, sugar, and butter
small file stored on a computer by a website to remember information about the user
examples: She baked chocolate chip cookies for the school fundraiser
The jar contained homemade oatmeal cookies
The website uses cookies to remember your login information
You should clear cookies regularly to protect your privacy

definitions: practice or skill of preparing food by combining, mixing, and heating ingredients
examples: Her cooking improved dramatically after taking professional classes
The smell of cooking filled the entire house

definitions: pots, pans, and other vessels and utensils used for cooking food
examples: The store sells professional-grade cookware for serious chefs
She received a complete set of cookware as a wedding gift

definitions: quality of being moderately cold or a refreshing lack of heat
quality of being calm and composed, especially in difficult situations
examples: The cool of the evening provided relief from the hot day
She enjoyed the cool breeze coming from the ocean
He maintained his cool despite the intense pressure
Losing your cool during negotiations weakens your position

definitions: liquid or gas used to prevent overheating in engines or industrial equipment
examples: The mechanic added coolant to the car's radiator system
The nuclear reactor uses specialized coolant for temperature control

definitions: portable insulated container used to keep food and drinks cold
device or system that cools air or liquid in buildings or machinery
examples: They packed sandwiches and drinks in the cooler for the picnic
The cooler kept the beverages cold throughout the beach day
The office installed a new water cooler in the break room
The CPU cooler prevents the computer processor from overheating

definitions: process of becoming cooler or making something less hot through heat removal
examples: The cooling of the metal takes several hours after forging
The cooling system prevents the engine from overheating

definitions: cage or enclosed structure where poultry, especially chickens, are kept
cooperative organization or store owned and operated by its members
examples: The chickens returned to their coop at sunset each evening
We built a sturdy coop to protect the hens from predators
She shops at the food coop for organic produce
The housing coop offers affordable apartments to members

definitions: process of working together toward the same goal or purpose with mutual assistance
examples: International cooperation is essential for addressing climate change
The project succeeded through cooperation between different departments

definitions: business or organization owned and operated jointly by its members who share profits
examples: The farmers formed a cooperative to market their produce together
The housing cooperative provides affordable homes for its members

definitions: set of numbers used to indicate the position of a point on a graph, map, or system
examples: The GPS coordinate showed their exact location in the wilderness
Plot these coordinates on the graph to find the intersection

definitions: organization of different elements of a complex body or activity to work together effectively
ability to use different parts of the body together smoothly and efficiently
examples: The event required careful coordination between multiple agencies
Project coordination involves managing timelines and resources effectively
The gymnast demonstrated exceptional coordination in her routine
Hand-eye coordination improves with regular practice

definitions: person responsible for organizing and harmonizing activities or efforts of a group
examples: The event coordinator managed every detail of the conference
She works as a project coordinator for the construction company

definitions: informal term for a police officer or member of law enforcement
examples: The cop directed traffic around the accident scene
Several cops responded to the emergency call downtown

definitions: machine that makes copies of documents, typically using photocopying technology
examples: The office copier jammed during the busy morning rush
They leased a high-speed copier for the print shop

definitions: second pilot of an aircraft who assists and can take over from the main pilot
examples: The copilot took control while the captain reviewed the weather report
Airlines require a copilot on all commercial flights

definitions: official who manages the household of a monarch or noble, historically a position of great trust
examples: The lord chamberlain organized all royal ceremonies and state functions
The chamberlain controlled access to the king's private chambers
